sentences.english: When I was listening to the final theme song, my heart was kind of stirred and could not calm down.
sentences.chinese: 聽着最後的主題曲，我的心情久久不能平靜。

sentences.english: Concise, after receipt of the g frequently reply in turn good mood.
sentences.chinese: 簡潔收到克勤的回覆後，心情轉好。

sentences.english: Looking up at the open sky, he suddenly cheered up.
sentences.chinese: 仰望碧天，他的心情豁然開朗。

sentences.english: Try breathing easily and gently tell yourself to relax.
sentences.chinese: 讓呼吸平靜下來，輕輕告戒自己放鬆心情。

sentences.english: I can discern the moods of the patrons as well.
sentences.chinese: 也能知道點曲人的心情。

sentences.english: He was buoyed up by thinking that he would recover.
sentences.chinese: 他想到還會恢復健康，心情也就開朗起來。

sentences.english: Fanny had not felt so comfortable for days and days.
sentences.chinese: 範妮多少天來從沒這樣心情舒暢過。

sentences.english: Negative feelings and moods are contagious as well.
sentences.chinese: 負面情緒和心情也是有感染力的。

sentences.english: We were all waiting for and dreading our notifications.
sentences.chinese: 我們都在心情忐忑的等待着。

sentences.english: I am grouchy due to lack of recent physical intimacy.
sentences.chinese: 我因爲最近缺少肌膚之親，所以心情不好。

sentences.english: In the most serious frame of mind Pierre drove up to the old prince's house.
sentences.chinese: 皮埃爾懷着極其嚴肅的心情乘車去老公爵家。

sentences.english: While in seclusion, reach beyond solitude for freedom.
sentences.chinese: 孤獨的心情與自由的空靈，對話一段曲徑通幽。

sentences.english: Calmness is needed in melancholy days. Believe that pleasantness is coming.
sentences.chinese: 在心情憂鬱的日子裏你需要冷靜，相信快樂即將到來。

sentences.english: On the journey home, the joy of the farm labourers was beyond description.
sentences.chinese: 還家旅途上，農民工的喜悅心情無法形容。

sentences.english: Because I have dared to open my mouth to sing at all.
sentences.chinese: 還是因爲我敢開口唱所以心情長。

sentences.english: Without you, today's emotions, would be the scurf of yesterday's.
sentences.chinese: 沒有你，今日的心情就只是昨日的頭皮屑。

definition: attitude (of the heart)/state of one's psyche/way of thinking/mentality
to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
